contents.title: City Mine(d) news
contents.description_html: Ter voorbereiding van een nieuw project in Noord London interviewde City Mine(d) de voorbije maanden onderzoekers, politici, activisten, syndicalisten, journalisten en zelfs een Nobelprijswinnaar over hoe lokale vaardigheden gevaloriseerd kunnen worden in een geglobaliseerde economie.

contents.title: Spatial Agency: Haus-Rucker-Co
contents.description_html: Taking their cue from the Situationist's ideas of play as a means of engaging citizens, Haus-Rucker-Co created performances where viewers became participants and could influence their own environments, becoming more than just passive onlookers. These installations were usually made from pneumatic structures such as Oase No.
contents.description: Taking their cue from the Situationist's ideas of play as a means of engaging citizens, Haus-Rucker-Co created performances where viewers became participants and could influence their own environments, becoming more than just passive onlookers. These installations were usually made from pneumatic structures such as Oase No.

contents.title: Research
contents.description_html: AFS undertakes research in the areas of low income housing, slums, informal/ squatter settlements, sustainable upgrading, government policy, sustainable building materials, low tech construction techniques and earth architecture.

contents.title: Factory Village : rufwork
contents.description_html: FACTORY VILLAGE Industrial production took hold after 1978 as global industries relocated to the attractive conditions offered by the special economic zones such as financial incentives, abundant resources of land and cheap labor. As a result many villages swapped fields for factories.
contents.description: FACTORY VILLAGE Industrial production took hold after 1978 as global industries relocated to the attractive conditions offered by the special economic zones such as financial incentives, abundant resources of land and cheap labor. As a result many villages swapped fields for factories.

contents.title: CRIT
contents.description_html: The urban realm today has no boundaries. It is emerging in new patterns transcending conventional notions of the city and metropolis in various scales, intensities and forms - as large infrastructure projects, as sites of redevelopment and rehabilitation, as luxury townships, special economic zones, call centers, malls, farmhouses, or even as enterprises within miniscule houses...
contents.description: The urban realm today has no boundaries. It is emerging in new patterns transcending conventional notions of the city and metropolis in various scales, intensities and forms - as large infrastructure projects, as sites of redevelopment and rehabilitation, as luxury townships, special economic zones, call centers, malls, farmhouses, or even as enterprises within miniscule houses...

contents.title: URBAN DESIGN-NODE stands for Nansha Original DEsign
contents.generated_title: URBAN DESIGN-NODE stands for Nansha Original DEsign
contents.description_html: NODE stands for Nansha Original DEsign (or NO DEsign) and was established in 2004. It is a small and high quality architectural practice in the Pearl River Delta region, which grew out of a series of projects associated and completed with the Fok Foundati
contents.description: NODE stands for Nansha Original DEsign (or NO DEsign) and was established in 2004. It is a small and high quality architectural practice in the Pearl River Delta region, which grew out of a series of projects associated and completed with the Fok Foundati

source.title: URBAN DESIGN-NODE stands for Nansha Original DEsign

contents.title: ConstructLab
contents.description_html: ConstructLab is a collaborative construction practice, working on both ephemeral and permanent projects. Unlike the conventional architectural process in which the architect designs and the builder builds, in constructLab, the project's conception and construction are brought together. The designer builds and continues to design on site.
contents.description: ConstructLab is a collaborative construction practice, working on both ephemeral and permanent projects. Unlike the conventional architectural process in which the architect designs and the builder builds, in constructLab, the project's conception and construction are brought together. The designer builds and continues to design on site.

contents.title: How to Become a Social Architect: Interview with Alejandro Haiek
contents.generated_title: How to Become a Social Architect: Interview with Alejandro Haiek
contents.description_html: Alejandro Haiek downplays his role as architect in defense of a slow yet transformative architecture ultimately powered by the community. Last November, we welcomed Venezuelan architect Alejandro Haiek as visiting professor of our program with a week-long workshop on Governance, Participation and Social Design.
contents.description: Alejandro Haiek downplays his role as architect in defense of a slow yet transformative architecture ultimately powered by the community. Last November, we welcomed Venezuelan architect Alejandro Haiek as visiting professor of our program with a week-long workshop on Governance, Participation and Social Design.

source.title: How to Become a Social Architect: Interview with Alejandro Haiek | Master of International Cooperation Sustainable Emergency Architecture

contents.title: Tutu's Hale - Hawaii
contents.description_html: Our Rookie Year was focused on repurposing a single family home deep in the Kokua Kalihi Valley into an off-grid community center. The scope included a significant amount of demolition, composting toilet, kupuna room, front and back lanais, site drainage, new roof addition, fire pit, banana circle, outdoor kitchen, and rain tanks.
contents.description: Our Rookie Year was focused on repurposing a single family home deep in the Kokua Kalihi Valley into an off-grid community center. The scope included a significant amount of demolition, composting toilet, kupuna room, front and back lanais, site drainage, new roof addition, fire pit, banana circle, outdoor kitchen, and rain tanks.

source.title: Tutu’s Hale – Hawaii | Build Lightly Studio

contents.title: on site
contents.description_html: The Non Profit Organisation for Architecture and Development buildCollective established in 2010 with founding members and architects Elias Rubin and Marlene Wagner, working in developing environments since 2006. buildCollective is a platform for research and implementation of alternative building technologies spatial strategies collective process Collaboration with universities, non governmental organizations, public institutions, companies, sponsors, schools, volunteers, artists, users and local communities define process and framework for each project.
contents.description: The Non Profit Organisation for Architecture and Development buildCollective established in 2010 with founding members and architects Elias Rubin and Marlene Wagner, working in developing environments since 2006. buildCollective is a platform for research and implementation of alternative building technologies spatial strategies collective process Collaboration with universities, non governmental organizations, public institutions, companies, sponsors, schools, volunteers, artists, users and local communities define process and framework for each project.

contents.title: Public Architecture " BlogPublic Architecture " puts the resources of architecture in the service of public interest
contents.generated_title: Public Architecture " BlogPublic Architecture " puts the resources of architecture in the service of public interest
contents.description_html: Happy New Year! As 2017 begins many people take the time to pause in reflection. We had a busy and exciting 2016 by connecting nonprofits with architects, engineers and designers. We have also continued to grow internally taking on new challenges for the year ahead.

contents.title: Public Architecture " ProjectsPublic Architecture
contents.description_html: Public Architecture's projects range from bringing healthcare to under served populations to creating policies that enable a new major university to support community vitality. We solve problems for organizations, foundations, and governments. By building teams with professionals from diverse backgrounds, we engage diverse tools and approaches, and offer each project a suite of tailored strategic services.
contents.description: Public Architecture's projects range from bringing healthcare to under served populations to creating policies that enable a new major university to support community vitality. We solve problems for organizations, foundations, and governments. By building teams with professionals from diverse backgrounds, we engage diverse tools and approaches, and offer each project a suite of tailored strategic services.
